page.title: 01WITHINGTON GENERAL VIEW
page.content: Withington is a parish and village on the{River Coln}in the eastern part of Gloucestershire with a population of around six hundred people. It is situated on the Cotswolds (150 metres above sea level) eight miles south east of Cheltenham and nine miles north of Cirencester.Withington is within the parliamentary constituency of{Tewkesbury and Cirencester.}Local government is administered through {Gloucestershire County Council, {Cotswold District Council and Parish {Council.} The area is one of outstanding natural beauty with steep valleys, wooded hillsides and houses built of the honey-coloured Cotswold stone.The main industry is agriculture but tourism is playing an increasingly important part. The area is also a popular place for people to spend their retirement.
